info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 02 at 7:52PM MDT until May 03 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The far southeast portion of the Southwest Highlands and southwest Southern Twin Falls County zones. * WHEN...From 6 AM to noon MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This advisory is for a small part of each zone. Temperatures will drop overnight enough to allow for accumulating snow, and winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Driving will become difficult on 3 Creek Rd / Jarbidge Rd extending from Highway 93 west and south to Murphy Hot Springs. Also, Highway 51 near Riddle will become difficult to travel as well. This is a late-season storm, and may surprise folks who need to travel in these areas Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
